data.title: the comics of Jodorowsky - The Indianapolis Public Library
data.meta_description:
the comics of Jodorowsky by IndyPL_RickD - a staff-created list : Alejandro Jodorowsky is a French-Chilean filmmaker, playwright, poet, mime, clown, magician, atheist mystic, and comic book author. He was part of the panic movement of the 1960's. His first movie, Fando y Lis premiered in Acapulco. When it started a riot, the film was banned in Mexico. He is also famous for having a very ambitious plan for making a "Dune" movie, that could not meet funding.

 His other movies like "El Topo" and "Holy Mountain" gained cult followings and were associated with midnight movies. Throughout the decades his work, and opinions have upset many people.  Even with his controversy he has fans ranging from John Lennon, to Marilyn Manson, to Kanye West 

I can confidently say, Jodorowsky is not for me. 

Sometimes I think he is inspired, other times I think he is overrated. Sometimes I am impressed with his ideas. Other times, it feels like exploitation, and make me nauseous. I can picture him telling me that he didn't make his comics to make me happy, he made his comics to send a message. I was reluctant to make a list of his comics, but his work has too big of an impact to ignore. #IndyPLAdults
data.text:
A "best hits" collection of the comic book universe by Jodorowsky and the many artists who have helped him. A "best hits" collection of the comic book universe by Jodorowsky and the many artists who have helped him. Show less

The sadistic queen of an ancient kingdom visits a neighboring kingdom and encounters their enlightened king. This king convinces her to abandon everything...Show more The sadistic queen of an ancient kingdom visits a neighboring kingdom and encounters their enlightened king. This king convinces her to abandon everything to go on a spiritual journey of rebirth. The cruel woman is a trope that appears regularly in Jodorowskys work. Show less

This series was written when Jodorowsky was involved in the panic artisitic movement from the 1960's. It seems like one of those stories where the point is to offend you or make you angry. This series was written when Jodorowsky was involved in the panic artisitic movement from the 1960's. It seems like one of those stories where the point is to offend you or make you angry. Show less

El Topo is an Avant-garde film made by and starring Alejandro Jodorowsky. Anyone who has seen it, can expect weirdness, religious imagery, shameless sacr...Show more El Topo is an Avant-garde film made by and starring Alejandro Jodorowsky. Anyone who has seen it, can expect weirdness, religious imagery, shameless sacrilege, and mysticism. The titular El Topo has been killed, around his grave there are seven golden pillars and a garden. The grave is on a plateau over an acid moat where the only way to get across is on floating rocks. If El Topo finds you unworthy, you fall below. One of the visitors is his son, Abel, who is invisible to the world. Show less

A fictional account of the first mafia dynasty. Painted by Milo Manara the same guy who did the controversial Spider-Woman cover in 2014. Both creators put in content that is much more graphic than a woman in tights striking a pose. A fictional account of the first mafia dynasty. Painted by Milo Manara the same guy who did the controversial Spider-Woman cover in 2014. Both creators put in content that is much more graphic than a woman in tights striking a pose. Show less

A collection of short stories, ranging from one sentence to one page in length. On the other page is Boucq's illustrations of what he imagined when he heard the stories. A collection of short stories, ranging from one sentence to one page in length. On the other page is Boucq's illustrations of what he imagined when he heard the stories. Show less

A creepy short story about a blind man who asks a crow to steal a pair of eyes. The crow finds a cat and goes after its eyes. A creepy short story about a blind man who asks a crow to steal a pair of eyes. The crow finds a cat and goes after its eyes. Show less

The origin stories of John DiFool. The only part that I was interested in was seeing how John and Deepo , the concrete seagull, met. The origin stories of John DiFool. The only part that I was interested in was seeing how John and Deepo , the concrete seagull, met. Show less

John Difool is part of a "degenerate dystopian planet" who finds himself in possession of one of the greatest weapons in the universe, the Incal...Show more John Difool is part of a "degenerate dystopian planet" who finds himself in possession of one of the greatest weapons in the universe, the Incal. This also makes him the biggest target in the universe. How will knowedge with the Metabaron prepare him from having to deal with the wrath of the Technopope? My favorite character is Deepo, the concrete seagull. Show less

The conclusion of the series, or is it the prequel? With how graphic these series can be, it almost seems that the Ligne Claire art style that Moebius used is a good way for readers to process the violent imagery. The conclusion of the series, or is it the prequel? With how graphic these series can be, it almost seems that the Ligne Claire art style that Moebius used is a good way for readers to process the violent imagery. Show less

Jose Ladronn contributed to the art. I thought that the name Ladronn was a pseudonym, but could not confirm it. Check out his art and see if the bandit ar...Show more Jose Ladronn contributed to the art. I thought that the name Ladronn was a pseudonym, but could not confirm it. Check out his art and see if the bandit artist will steal your attention. In this volume John DiFool is put in the middle of two powerful intelligences battling, light vs dark , nature vs technology. Who will be the winner? Show less

After the Incal and the Final Incal are the same story. It is interesting to see how two different artists took the prompts and how they portrayed it on p...Show more After the Incal and the Final Incal are the same story. It is interesting to see how two different artists took the prompts and how they portrayed it on panels. I was also glad to see that even though Moebius could not finish illustrating the series, the publishing companies still displayed his work. Show less

In the future on an interstellar starship you eavesdrop on one robot telling another robot a story. They are talking about their Metabaron. The story sur...Show more In the future on an interstellar starship you eavesdrop on one robot telling another robot a story. They are talking about their Metabaron. The story surrounds a rare oil that allows anything to float. It was originally a secret of a few stonecutters but knowledge of it has erupted a interplanetary war over this rare substance. You can see the connection with the unfinished Dune project. Show less

Jodorowsky begins setting the stage for what will eventually become the Metabarons, including their violent rites of passage, and why the Metabarons and the Technopriests are enemies of each other. Jodorowsky begins setting the stage for what will eventually become the Metabarons, including their violent rites of passage, and why the Metabarons and the Technopriests are enemies of each other. Show less

If the Metabarons series was based off of the unfunded draft of "Dune" The Metabaron sets up the parallel between the Technopope and the House Harkonnen. The attraction to this is the art by Jerry Frissen and Valentin Secher. If the Metabarons series was based off of the unfunded draft of "Dune" The Metabaron sets up the parallel between the Technopope and the House Harkonnen. The attraction to this is the art by Jerry Frissen and Valentin Secher. Show less

This appears to start after the events of Metabarons volume 2. I did enjoy the rocket that is all black with the yellow stripes like a sports car. I especially like Zoran Janjentov and Travis Charests art work on the fight against the Leodactyl. This appears to start after the events of Metabarons volume 2. I did enjoy the rocket that is all black with the yellow stripes like a sports car. I especially like Zoran Janjentov and Travis Charests art work on the fight against the Leodactyl. Show less

A white haired man is telling a small furry creature a story about himself. He talks about how his mother ,Panepha, was abused and abandoned on a station...Show more A white haired man is telling a small furry creature a story about himself. He talks about how his mother ,Panepha, was abused and abandoned on a station with these weird tardigrade looking bovine creatures. She made a fortune by making their milk into cheese, and things get weirder from there. Panepha starts off as the victim but eventually becomes the cruel woman in this series. Show less

If you haven't already guessed from the scary lady on the front cover, Princess Schalise is the cruel woman in this series. Megalex is a dystopian horror....Show more If you haven't already guessed from the scary lady on the front cover, Princess Schalise is the cruel woman in this series. Megalex is a dystopian horror. Megalex is a planet that is almost entirely one city. Only natural parts are one forest and one lake, which is at war with the metal city. Part one sees a clone police officer who knows that being different from the rest should be the death of him. Can he escape? Show less

A young boy flying on a kite is shot down by a plane. Their religious leader destroys himself, and transcends to a higher state. As you see missionaries c...Show more A young boy flying on a kite is shot down by a plane. Their religious leader destroys himself, and transcends to a higher state. As you see missionaries coming in, the leader has been reincarnated. How will the reincarnated leader stand against the modern world coming into the mountain community. Show less

A college professor has his students follow him around like a cult leader. You can recognize them by the fact that they wear only purple. One of the stude...Show more A college professor has his students follow him around like a cult leader. You can recognize them by the fact that they wear only purple. One of the students claim to be pregnant with his baby, who she believes is the reincarnation of John the Baptist. Show less

A one armed man roams the desert. A one eyed Confederate Colonel still fights the Civil War even after the South lost. Greed leads to violence as the Colo...Show more A one armed man roams the desert. A one eyed Confederate Colonel still fights the Civil War even after the South lost. Greed leads to violence as the Colonel and his brother fight in search of a lost diamond. The mother of the protagonist and antagonist brothers is the cruel woman in this comic, she is also the last person to have the missing diamond. Show less

Dark clouds surround a small kingdom. The dark lord Tartarath has taken the king. The kings twin children, must go on a quest to save their father with th...Show more Dark clouds surround a small kingdom. The dark lord Tartarath has taken the king. The kings twin children, must go on a quest to save their father with their flying guardian, Lyrena. One rule is that they must not ride Lyrena like a horse, but there are loopholes such as she can catch them to break their fall or walking across her back to get across a chasm. Then ending felt anticlimactic. I feel like Jodorowsky was trying to get out of his comfort zone and be different, although you can tell its his work. Show less

In order to bring rain, a community does a mock crucifixion. The man on the cross thinks about his hard life of crime that lead up to this moment. In order to bring rain, a community does a mock crucifixion. The man on the cross thinks about his hard life of crime that lead up to this moment. Show less

Screaming planet is a collection of short stories collected throughout the years. Contributors include Argentinian artists Carlos Meglia and Gustavo Cabra...Show more Screaming planet is a collection of short stories collected throughout the years. Contributors include Argentinian artists Carlos Meglia and Gustavo Cabral who goes under the pseudonym "Ciruelo." Also included is Axel Mendellin operating from Mexico. Show less
